intro: Clermontia waimeae var. longisepala, commonly known as the Waimea mountain ginger, is a rare Hawaiian plant characterized by its striking, showy flowers. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the island of Oahu. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forested areas. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
